tournament.name: Pro Tour Murders at Karlov Manor

decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressive play with Rakdos creatures and removal spells, aiming to put pressure on opponents early in the game. It uses a mix of efficient creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Vein Ripper, along with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board and keep the pressure on. Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord provides additional creature support and synergy. The deck also includes a few powerful late-game threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse for added versatility. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently with a combination of creatures and removal spells.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on efficient creatures with low mana costs that can quickly apply pressure to the opponent. The deck includes a mix of protection spells, combat tricks, and direct damage to ensure that your creatures can deal damage swiftly and efficiently. The companion Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional value and flexibility to the deck. The goal of this deck is to maintain a fast tempo and overwhelm your opponent with a relentless onslaught of creatures and combat tricks.

The deck focuses on utilizing the life gain abilities of Amalia Benavides Aguirre and Prosperous Innkeeper to ramp up mana and gain advantage. It also includes a selection of creatures and spells that synergize with life gain, such as Wildgrowth Walker and Chord of Calling. The inclusion of cards like Aetherflux Reservoir and Return to the Ranks highlights the combo potential of the deck, allowing the player to snowball their life total into a win condition. Overall, the deck aims to create a fast and powerful combo engine centered around life gain.

This deck revolves around utilizing Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly, enabling powerful combo plays. It runs a mix of ramp creatures, card draw spells, and tutors to find key pieces of the combo. The win condition often involves casting Emergent Ultimatum to search for game-winning spells like Omniscience or a lethal threat. The deck aims to control the game early on, then explode with a powerful combo finish once it has assembled the necessary pieces.

The deck focuses on quickly bringing back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard to the battlefield to deal damage and pressure the opponent. It uses cheap spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe to trigger the Phoenix's ability, while also controlling the opponent's board with cards like Spell Pierce and Prismari Command. The deck also includes card draw spells like Opt and Treasure Cruise to maintain card advantage, and has some disruptive elements with cards like Jwari Disruption and Torch the Tower. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. The deck aims to be aggressive with cards like Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster while also maintaining card advantage with Consider, Opt, and Treasure Cruise. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Spell Pierce and Jwari Disruption to protect its creatures. Additionally, the inclusion of Hall of Storm Giants provides a powerful late-game threat. This deck focuses on a fast, graveyard-based aggro strategy with a potential for explosive plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing for explosive plays and powerful combos. The deck includes cards that can search for Lotus Field, untap it, and abuse its mana abilities, as well as powerful spells that can be cast for free with the help of Lotus Field's mana generation. The goal is to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with high-impact spells and game-winning combos.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Vein Ripper, supported by card advantage from cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Dusk Legion Zealot. The deck also includes disruption spells like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Duress to control the opponent's game plan. Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord can provide additional support and finishers for the deck. The deck is designed to apply pressure early in the game and maintain control of the board with efficient removal and disruptive spells.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and aggressively fill up your graveyard with cards like Arclight Phoenix, while using cards like Picklock Prankster and Ledger Shredder to disrupt your opponent's game plan. By constantly casting cheap spells like Opt and Fiery Impulse, you can bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and deal damage to your opponent. Cards like Treasure Cruise and Temporal Trespass help you draw more cards to keep the pressure on, while Ashiok, Dream Render can disrupt your opponent's graveyard strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and lethal assault.

The deck focuses on utilizing creatures and spells to gain life and generate mana to either cast powerful spells or assemble a combo win condition with cards like Aetherflux Reservoir. The deck includes a mix of creatures that gain life, tutor for key pieces, and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company, the deck can quickly find key combo pieces. The deck also includes some disruption in the form of Thoughtseize. The deck aims to establish board presence while setting up for a game-winning combo finish.

The deck focuses on generating value through creature ETB triggers and gaining life while assembling a combo win condition with Aetherflux Reservoir. It utilizes cards like Wildgrowth Walker, Voice of Resurgence, and Amalia Benavides Aguirre to gain life and generate tokens. The deck also includes ways to tutor for combo pieces with cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling. The mana base includes lands that can produce multiple colors of mana to support the deck's diverse casting cost requirements. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue opponents while setting up a game-winning combo finish.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and drawing cards to maintain card advantage. It utilizes cards like Deduce, Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, Negate, and Shark Typhoon to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also ramping up to powerful late-game threats like Torrential Gearhulk and Dig Through Time. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with efficient removal and card draw, while also being able to close out the game with powerful finishers like Shark Typhoon and Sheoldred's Edict.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gradually building card advantage. The deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset to generate advantage and provide additional control options. The inclusion of Shark Typhoon allows for a win condition that can quickly close out games in the late game. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency and stability throughout the game. Ultimately, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory by grinding out incremental advantages.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the board and countering opponent's spells while utilizing card advantage and card draw. It aims to stall the game and slowly gain advantage through powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also includes various counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Zirda, the Dawnwaker is included as a companion to reduce the cost of activated abilities, providing additional value and flexibility to the control strategy. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells in the Rakdos colors. It utilizes cards like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, Bloodtithe Harvester, and Graveyard Trespasser to pressure the opponent early on, while also having removal spells like Fatal Push and Bonecrusher Giant to deal with threats. The deck aims to maintain a constant stream of pressure, disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, ultimately aiming to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly creating a board presence with low-cost artifacts and aggro creatures, then utilizing various spells and abilities to deal damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds a unique element to the deck construction. By combining aggressive artifact creatures with cards like Shrapnel Blast and Gleeful Demolition, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory. The mana base is designed to provide flexibility in casting spells quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on utilizing the card Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to create powerful combos with cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Indomitable Creativity. It also includes a variety of control elements such as Dovin's Veto and Supreme Verdict to protect the combo pieces. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for extra versatility and card advantage. The deck aims to be creative in its approach to winning the game, utilizing a mix of board control, card advantage, and combo potential.

The deck focuses on a aggressive strategy that revolves around sacrificing creatures for various effects. It utilizes cards like Cauldron Familiar, Mayhem Devil, and Witch's Oven to pressure the opponent while gaining incremental value from sacrificing creatures. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's board and hand. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion provides additional mana ramp and consistency to the deck. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature pressure and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures and tokens to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. It also includes cards that support the aggressive strategy by boosting creatures' stats or providing additional combat tricks. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle by ensuring consistency in casting spells while also including utility lands for additional benefits. Overall, the Boros Aggro archetype aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient offense, making it difficult for them to stabilize and counterattack.

The main concept of this Aggro Red Deck Wins Pioneer 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient and low-cost burn spells like Play with Fire, Lightning Helix, and Skewer the Critics, along with creatures such as Bonecrusher Giant and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck aims to control the board and pressure the opponent with hasty creatures and direct damage spells, ultimately winning the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The deck also utilizes cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel to punish the opponent for casting non-creature spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful creatures and enchantments for free, while controlling the board with cards like Leyline Binding and Temporary Lockdown. The strategy revolves around establishing a strong board presence and locking down your opponent's options, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of big threats like Elesh Norn and Atraxa. The inclusion of Enigmatic Incarnation allows for even more flexibility and consistency in finding the right creatures for the situation. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building towards a dominant board state.

This deck revolves around generating mana and ramping up quickly to play powerful creatures and spells. The goal is to utilize the high mana cost cards efficiently by combining them with cheaper cards like Spark Double and Release to the Wind. With the help of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion, the combo potential is maximized, allowing for explosive turns and overwhelming board presence. The inclusion of Leyline Binding and Quintorius Kand adds a control aspect to the deck, enabling it to handle a variety of situations effectively.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play and utilize artifact creatures and artifacts to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By combining cards like Ensoul Artifact and Smuggler's Copter with powerful support spells like Shrapnel Blast and Gleeful Demolition, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient strategy. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck's game plan. Overall, the focus is on using artifacts and aggro strategies to secure a victory in the Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. With a mix of counters like Dovin's Veto and removal like Supreme Verdict, the deck aims to answer threats while generating value with Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Shark Typhoon. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents and drawing cards. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by playing a longer game and utilizing powerful control elements to dictate the pace of the match.

This UW Control deck focuses on countering and removing threats while drawing cards and gaining card advantage through spells like Dig Through Time and Memory Deluge. It aims to control the board with cards like Supreme Verdict and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, while utilizing lands like Field of Ruin and Castle Vantress to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cards like No More Lies and Get Lost to disrupt the opponent's hand and prevent key combos from being executed. The overall strategy is to maintain control of the game until the late game where it can establish dominance and win.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to swarm the board with low-cost creatures like Favored Hoplite, Monastery Swiftspear, and Tenth District Legionnaire, and pump them up with spells like Defiant Strike, Monstrous Rage, and Reckless Rage to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes protection spells like Gods Willing and combat tricks like Homestead Courage to keep the creatures alive and get them through for damage. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional flexibility and consistency to the deck.

This deck aims to assemble the Lotus Field combo as quickly as possible by using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Vizier of Tumbling Sands to generate multiple mana from a single land. Once Lotus Field is online, the deck can generate an abundance of mana to cast powerful spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience. The deck also includes ways to search for necessary pieces, protect key cards with Boseiju, Who Endures, and manipulate the board with Hidden Strings. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to set up a powerful combo engine to overwhelm opponents with big plays.

This Rakdos Aggro deck utilizes aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Vein Ripper, along with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, to quickly overwhelm opponents and keep them on the defensive. Cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord help to generate additional threats and maintain pressure on the opponent. With a mix of efficient creatures, removal, and card advantage engines, this deck aims to establish early dominance and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on assembling the Lotus Field combo by ramping and tutoring for the key pieces. Using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Vizier of Tumbling Sands to untap Lotus Field and generate mana, the deck aims to cast powerful spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience to overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Lier, Disciple of the Drowned provide protection and recursion for key combo pieces. The deck also utilizes utility lands like Lair of the Hydra and Hedge Maze to further support the combo strategy.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck includes a variety of ways to disrupt the opponent's strategies, control the board, and generate card advantage through cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Memory Deluge. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as the companion, providing additional value by flickering permanents for extra value. The deck also includes supplementary win conditions in the form of burn spells and creatures like Regal Caracal. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through incremental advantage.

This Rakdos Sacrifice deck focuses on utilizing sacrifice effects to deal damage to the opponent while generating value through effects like Mayhem Devil and Witch's Oven. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency and flexibility to the deck's mana base. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain a steady stream of damage through sacrificing creatures and triggering powerful effects.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through a combination of removal spells and enchantments. It utilizes Fires of Invention to cast spells for free and Enigmatic Incarnation to tutor for specific creatures. The addition of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for extra value with blink effects. The deck also includes a variety of powerful creatures with disruptive abilities to further control the game. Overall, the key concept is to maintain board control while setting up a win condition through powerful creatures and advantageous board states.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and disrupting opponents with discard spells. The key strategy involves efficiently removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize while developing a board presence with creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Vein Ripper. Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord provides additional utility and synergizes well with the vampire creatures in the deck. The deck aims to pressure opponents early and maintain a steady stream of threats to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Indomitable Creativity card to convert noncreature tokens generated by spells like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Shark Typhoon into powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier or The Wandering Emperor. The deck also includes control elements such as Lightning Helix, Dovin's Veto, and Chained to the Rocks to protect your combo pieces. The inclusion of Prismari Command and No More Lies provides flexibility in dealing with a variety of threats, while the mana base ensures consistent access to the necessary colors for the combo to work effectively.

The deck focuses on utilizing Greasefang, Okiba Boss to generate value and control the board, while also incorporating Parhelion II as a win condition. The deck contains various cards for card advantage and disruption, such as Thoughtseize, Grisly Salvage, and Raffine's Informant. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Skysovereign, Consul Flagship and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse for additional value and removal. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly through the synergy between Lotus Field and other cards like Vizier of Tumbling Sands and Hidden Strings. The goal is to ramp up to big spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience while using cards like Archdruid's Charm and Pore Over the Pages for card advantage and selection. The addition of Lutri, the Spellchaser as a companion adds an extra layer of complexity and versatility to the deck. The main strategy revolves around assembling key pieces to set up explosive combo turns and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn to gain card advantage and control the battlefield. By including a variety of multicolored cards, the deck can efficiently cast Niv-Mizzet and trigger its powerful ability to draw cards. The deck also includes a mix of control elements such as counterspells, removal, and board wipes to maintain control of the game. Additionally, the inclusion of Bring to Light allows for flexible tutoring, while the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value with its blink effect. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through card advantage and efficient control options.

Creatures with Copy effects are used to duplicate powerful combos in order to overwhelm the opponent with multiple threats on the battlefield. The deck focuses on creating an army of large creatures quickly and efficiently, leveraging the resource advantage provided by the companion Keruga, the Macrosage. By combining ramp spells with strong creature copies, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace opponents in the mid-to-late game, seizing control of the board and pressuring the opponent into submission.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to establish board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan through counter spells, board wipes, and card advantage. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value with flickering effects. The deck aims to control the pace of the game with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Shark Typhoon, while also utilizing card draw and selection to ensure consistency in obtaining answers. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the control strategy and enable access to a variety of powerful spells.
